Reviews.Title: “Luxury Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Motel One and I think they have successfully created their own rating, Budget Luxury. My room was only $77 (cheapest room I could find during Easter) a night yet the hotel was very modern, clean, and trendy decor. The concept is simple; you get a nice room with no perks for cheap. Yes the room doesn't have a closet, phone, mini bar, etc. But for those of us that are on a budget yet we want a nice, clean, and modern room to come back to after a day of shopping and touring this is the perfect hotel. Last year I experienced some issues with the wifi internet but this year I asked for a room close to the router. The front desk clerk recommended a room on the Z floor which is where the hotel gets the best internet. I was in room Z35 and the internet worked perfectly this year. I definitely recommend this hotel and I hope the Motel One concept comes to the U.S.A. soon.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janzurly
Reviews.Content: I have been to ITB Berlin,friend of mine has recommened this hotel for me,it is my styel i liked very much ,very quiet,clean,friendly.cheap,good staff,centerlized.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place that exceeded our expectatipns”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_spb
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st stay at Motel One hotel, but not the last for sure :). We chose this hotel for our New Year trip to Berlin and were glad with our choice. The hotel is modern, clean, stylish. The staff is young, very friendly, amiable and helpful. Despite that the hotel is big, it is very quiet and clean, has a nice and cosy bar with good selection of drinks and snacks. The room is small but very comfortable, is equipped with everything you need, plus has a nice and trendy decor. If you pay for breakfast (7.50 euro) you will have unlimited wi-fi access, which was working good in our room. Also there is wi-fi in lobby for free and you can take iPad at reception and use it in lobby for free. Bathroom is the tinest I've ever seen, but also comfirtable and there is a good hairdryer, shower and big mirrors. Beds and linen are nice - we slept very well. Rooms were cleaned every day and towels were changed regularly. Breakfast is very good - plenty of food - corn flakes, muesli, different types of cheese, ham, bread, croissants, eggs, fresh fruits and vegetables. There is no hot dishes (which might be good in winter times), however this does not spoil impression from unhurried and substantial breakfast. Location is the greatest advantage of this Motel One - 3 min from Kudamm, KaDeWe and the nearest U station. It is very easy to get to the both airports (Tegel and Schoenefeld) from it and to the main sightseeings of Berlin. Zoo is 10 min of walking distance. There are only three things i didn't like - payment at check in, very high temperature at hallways and broken towel hanger in the bathroom. On the whole, Motel One Tiergarten is a perfect value for money with a great location. I'd recommend it to my friends and choose hotels of this chain for future for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for little money”
Reviews.Author: Hboe
Reviews.Content: I stayed previously at another hotel in this chain, and was equally pleased. The hotel is fresh, clean and modern. The hotel bar is very good and cosy with a good selection of drinks. The rooms are equipped with everything you need, incl. a good hairdryer! Only downsides are the beds are quite hard and the temperature in the hallways etc is very warm! The 2 star rating is probably dependant on the things you don't use anyway when you're travelling, like in-room phone, mini-bar and fitness-room ;-) Overall I can hardly believe that you can stay at this hotel for such a low price. I'll definately stay at a Motel One next time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: dave080
Reviews.Content: Very trendy and relaxed hotel. Value for money. Great decor, very clean. Seems to cater more for couples and professionals. Excellent breakfast. I don't like the fact you have to pay as you check in. Good location. U-Bahn station five minute walk away, great shops etc

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for staying more than a night”
Reviews.Author: iii_guess
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (5 minutes on foot to the nearest subway station, Wittenberg Plats), bus stop 500 meters away from the hotel, plenty of nice cafees and restaurants, shops and supermarkets (incl. KaDeWe, of course). Hotel is big (7 floors), quit, cleaning every day. However there's no single rooms, only doubles, so if you travel alone (as i do) the price is a bit more expensive than i expected. In spite of that i highly reccomend this hotel as a place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good but..”
Reviews.Author: Ifco
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, rooms are clean, but: 1. WIFI connection - mostly not working. I see stupid login screen every 5 minutes. So wifi is not usuable 2. Breakfast - not so much to choose

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel but shower and wireless were frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: paperfree
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was reasonably close to the U-bahn line my husband needed to be on for work, it got good reviews on tripadvisor, and it was cheap. Internet: When we checked in we asked the woman at the desk if the room came with free wifi. She said only if you paid for breakfast (7.50 per day), but she couldn't tell if we had paid for breakfast. One of her colleagues came to her rescue and showed her that we had not paid for breakfast. So then the wireless internet cost 5 euros a day. What she didn't tell us was because of the password system only one computer/device could be logged on at a time, unless you pay 10 euros a day to get two passwords. And the login screen was deathly slow to appear, and sometime didn't show up at all. The wireless occasionally stopped working entirely, or kicked us off and made us login again. It was quite annoying. There is also free wifi in the lobby, but you need a password to use that as well. ROOM and BED: The apartment was very clean and modern looking. The bed was two twin beds in one frame, with the annoying crack down the middle, and separate twin comforters for each person. The mattress was firm, and we found it comfortable. The room was small with no drawers--just a few hangers to hang shirts up, and open shelves on only one side of the bed. I would have preferred shelves on both sides of the bed, but it was acceptable. Note there is no telephone in the room so if you need to talk to the front desk you have to go down. There is a public telephone in the lobby. NOISE and TEMPERATURE: The room was pretty quiet. We heard only muffled sounds from the neighboring room. The room was quite warm even without the heat on, but we just opened a window and the temperature was fine. The hallways were very warm. BATHROOM: The bathroom had a very nice modern shower with plenty of hot water and good pressure (but no bath). But the shower could not hold a constant temperature. The water switched between cool and boiling hot. I almost got burned several times. This was an issue at all times of the day. The bathroom also had a hair dryer. FOOD: We never tried the breakfast. FITNESS CENTER: None. COST: 74 euros a night. Pretty cheap. (Plus 5 euros per day wireless costs per computer.) LOCATION: The location was okay, not great. It's pretty close to the Wittenbergplatz U-bahn, but at night when it was cold I personally wished it was just a tad closer. (I'm a wimp when it comes to the cold.) The street it's on is pretty busy and the area in general is not at all charming, and there's not a lot in the immediate vicinity in terms of restaurants and cafes. There are more charming areas closer to Savignyplatz or Nollendorfplatz. OVERALL: If you're planning to stay in this area, the Motel One Berlin-Tiergarten hotel is an acceptable choice (except for the constantly changing temperature of the shower and the annoying issues with the wifi). But next time we will probably try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: h_mchugh
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just got back from a 4 night stay at Motel One Tiergarten, and it was fab! The hotel is in a great location just 5 mins walk from Wittenbergplatz underground station from where you can get to most areas if the city. This hotel is ultra modern and chic and I still can't believe we got it for 74 euros per night. Motel one is a budget hotel chain, but from my experience there was nothing budget about this hotel! The hotel was so clean and decorated beautifully, and had all the facilities you would expect. We got free wifi because we paid for breakfast which was lovely and set you up well for the day. Wifi was a bit hit and miss, but ok for free. There is a 24 hour bar as well.serving a great choice of drinks and cocktails. Iron and board available on request for a deposit. All in all a great hotel, would definitely use this chain again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AlVoyager
Reviews.Content: Motel One chain always maintains its level of comfort. Location is good, close to Wittenbergplatz U-Bahn station. The only drawback is that the red U-Bahn like is under repair and you cannot board it from Wittenbergplats station. There is an express bus from Zoologischer Garten station to Tegel airport. The room is clean with Loewe flat TV on the wall. Breakfast is good with great fresh espresso that you cannot expect at such a low room price. Wi-Fi internet is complimentary if you buy a breakfast. There is a Kaiser's grocery store near U-Bahn station so you can buy, say, a sushi for dinner. So this hotel is a top price/performance ration, I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: fere0010
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Motel One during Berlin Marathon. Very good location. Only a few minutes walk to the start. The hotel is very clean and offered all I needed. The staff was very helpful - they helped my finding a phone number of a friend, recommended me a decent restaurant and helped me with my Internet problems. What amazed me most is how similar Motel One hotels are. I stayed in a Motel One in Nürnberg before and it looked exactly the same. Same look and feel of the lobby, same room layout, ... Seems with Motel One you know what you get :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, fun hotel, terrible wifi!”
Reviews.Author: SimonJWK
Reviews.Content: Really nice, super clean hotel, great breakfast Only two criticisms would be poor changing frequency of bed line and the totally frustratingly appalling internet service. Tolerable if it was free -maybe ;) - but just ridiculous for a 'paid for' service. The Management really need to address the in -room wifi

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: novato-dave
Reviews.Content: + Professional environment, friendly staff, reasonable prices, great breakfast, clean rooms, and very easy to book or cancel on-line. They also print documents for you, such as on-line train tickets. - once I had to ask for new towels. Free internet downstairs; free internet in room only with purchase of breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: senhoj2
Reviews.Content: A spanking new hotel in this "no frills" chain (already 7 in Berlin!). Reception and service exemplary; young, very helpful staff. Decent size and modern design bedrooms, light and airy (windows which open); comfortable beds, good bathrooms. 24hr. bar with cheap drinks and light snacks. I believe Internet, phones etc can be hired from reception. No restaurant and the lobby/breakfast area could get busy, but was quiet the weekend I stayed. Tree-lined street , surprisingly quiet at night. 5 min. walk to central shops, U-Bahn.. All this for under 60€ a night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at a bargain”
Reviews.Author: jetlag83
Reviews.Content: We spend three days in the Motel One in Berlin, and it was an excellent experience. Our first impression: Very design-oriented hotel in a great location, the staff was friendly, early check-in was no problem at all. Location: The hotel is in a great location in Berlin - only minutes away from KDW, Kurfürstendamm, Bus 100, various restaurants and subway lines. Staff: The staff at the hotel is very helpful and friendly and always offering service with a smile.. Rooms: The roomes are very very stylish, and the design is continued throughout the entire hotel, which gives a great look. The bed was really comfortable, the room itself very quiet. BE AWARE! Dont expect huge rooms! The rooms are rather small (due to the fact, that it is a budget design hotel), but have been smartly reduced to what you really need for a short city trip and what really counts (no large desk, no big cupboard, small desk can be moved around). The bathrooms are small as well, but have a big shower (approx. 2 square metres). Amenities: Free wifi in the lobby on request; Wifi in room at additional charge. Breakfast available on additional charge (not tested) The hotel bar offers a variety of drinks and good cocktails at very reasonable prices. Other amenities have not been tested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money... would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: TiggerThompson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel shortly after it had opened. Great value for money rooms were compact but very comfortable. Gone to Berlin for a city break and a concert. Great location near KA-DE-WE, and the UBahn for connections to other parts of the city. For 79 Euro's a night I can't fault it I have paid more in worse locations in other cities. Breakfast was fine for and extra 7 Euros each. Definately use the chain again when travelling in Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent No Frills”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Motel One in April 2011 and found the hotel to be very nice, simple and met most of our needs while visiting Berlin. The hotel was not far from the airport, close to the train station, and convenient to the tour buses that travel throughout the city. The lobby was nice and modern and the rooms were small and clean. The rooms offered no frills, like no telephone in the room or no closets. If you wanted to contact the front desk you had to go down to the lobby and talk to them in person. The internet was probably my biggest complaint about this hotel, it was very spotty and the connection would drop off line frequently. However, if you want a very comfortable room to store your bags, shower, and sleep for a great price this would be my recommendation. This hotel offers a great concept; a nice room with no extras that most people never use, but pay for them in the nightly room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda hip, kinda budget, kinda central location”
Reviews.Author: jgb10011
Reviews.Content: For USA readers, imagine if Motel 6 had a boutique brand and you have Motel One. While the lobby is very large, inviting and smart, the rooms are rather small and bare bones, but yet still quite functional and kind of hip. Bathrooms are very very small, but functional. Flat plasma TV, but no phone or clocks in the room. Go figure. Young, very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is priced about the same as other mid-ranged properties nearby (such as Holiday Inn Express) and the guests tend to be younger singles (though families would feel comfortable there). Breakfast is an additional 7.50 Euros (plentiful cold, but no hot selections) and for some odd reason WiFi access is included in the cost of you pre-purchased breakfast. If the price were roughly the same as neighboring properties during my next visit to Berlin, I'd likely choose this Motel One.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: aguilara
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with the perfect price. Location was close to Wittenbergplatz and Nollendorfplatz U-bahn stations, KaDeWe and major shopping street Ku'Damm. The front staff was very nice and happily spoke English. My flight arrived early and was expecting to wait for a room till 3 p.m., but they had a room ready for me at 10:00 a.m. when I arrived, which was a relief - was very jetlagged and needed a nap. The room is not as small as expected and the bathroom was very nice. The only minor thing is that the bed wasn't as comfortable - but again, minor. Free WiFi in the lobby - make to ask front desk for a ticket with login information. Highly, highly recommend. The price for what you get is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “A Pristine Bargain”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: I had four nights in Berlin and booked a familiar up scale chain, Hilton, for safety the first night. Got a good rate, but found the usual Hilton "sock it to 'em" nonsense unacceptable and booked this unknown hotel for the remaining three nights. This was a great move because my three nights at Motel One came to less than one night at the Hilton!!!! As the other reviews do point out, you must be willing to give up some perks: (1) there are no phones in the rooms. For me no big deal except that you cannot phone the desk and ask for help with internet or whatever. (2) Rooms are compact, but I have slept in smaller ones for this price and more. (3) Not exactly in the mainstream although a short walk takes you to U-bahn, trains or buses, plenty of restaurants and shopping. (4) City tour buses stop nearby, but not at front door.(5) no restaurant but a lobby bar that is well suited for evening drinks or coffee. The lobby here is huge and breakfast (Add 7.50 Euro) is great. What isn't in the rooms (such as an iron and board), you can get with a small deposit at the desk. Free WiFi in lobby and included if you buy breakfast. Internet in the room was excellent. Hotel is well insulated and the room was quiet. Bottom line: A fine place to hang your hat in Berlin and you will save enough to dine out fashionably in th evenings.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for city trips”
Reviews.Author: udie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one week at the beginning of September 2010, while we visited a conference in Belin. Staff at the check in were very friendly. I shared a room with a colleague of mine. The room was small but it was equipped with everything one expects in a hotel room. The bed was big enough and the bathroom was new. There was a TV, a hairdryer and a chair as well as a writing desk . The room was cleaned every day, sheets were changed daily as well as were the towels and the bath carpet. All in all the room was super clean, no hairs to be found anywhere. Breakfast costs extra (about 7,50 Euro) but it really is worth the money and unlimited Wireless Lan is included in the fee. The lounge is open 24h you can get drinks and some snacks there. All sights as well as the conference at the Freie Universität Berlin were easy to reach via tube and bus. I think this hotel is the perfect choice for a city trip. Erverything is easy to reach and there are also some sights nearby. For example the Ka De We, the Kurfürstendamm, the Zoo and so on. If you want to stay in your room the whole day, this hotel might not be the right choice for you as it i rather small. I would definitely choose this hotel again, and there are also other hotels of the same chain all over Berlin, which I expect to be as perfect as this one was.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean rooms and excellent breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: lothloria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Motel One Urania for 3 nights as it was included in our bus trip to Berlin. The hotel is situated in Ku'Damm, the Kaiser Wilhelm Gedächtnis Kirche is at walking distance and the big store "KaDeWe" is just around the corner. The closest U-bahn (tube-station) is also very close (Wittenbergplatz). If you want to go somewhere it is easy to go by bus or U-bahn from here. The room was nice. Only thing about it was that it was very small. Didn't matter to us, because we were mostly in town, but it could be good to know. Neither of us really liked the mattresses in the bed either. It was no problem sleeping, but they felt hard, even if the pamphlet guaranteed the mattresses and linen to be of greatest quality. I do not doubt the quality, but as said, it was pretty hard, but that is also very individual. Also the tv was a bit funny situated, it was put to the left of the bed, not in front of the bed as usual. There is nothing wrong with it really, only it felt weird looking in that angle on the tv screen. Otherwise we really enjoyed the breakfast buffét. There were 4 or 5 kinds of bread, youghurh, several things to choose among to put on your bread, eggs and so on. For us Swedes, there was plenty. Note, though, that it wasn't anything hot, for example beans or bacon or scrambled eggs, only normal boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jupiter03
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) beautiful hotel 2) centrally located in w.berlin 3) 2 mins walk from underground, really big shopping area and hordes of restaurants 4) 24 hours bar 5) clean, rooms 6) friendly staff 7) free internet in the hotel lobby Cons: 1) Small rooms with no mini bars... But seriously, you are in Berlin!!! Why would you want to stay in your room???

Reviews.Title: “I'm staying here next time I'm in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Margaritata
Reviews.Content: Hotel is brand new, very stylish and cozy. Rooms have were a bit small, but had everything we needed. Shower was great and you can tell that bed lined is new. Our breakfast was included, but we struggles to find seats. So I would advise to go for breakfast earlier!

HotelInfo.Name: Motel One Berlin-Tiergarten
HotelInfo.Address: An der Urania 12/14, 10787 Berlin, Germany (Formerly Motel One Berlin-Urania)
